resources.string:
This is the bio of Pietro Mennea Pietro Paolo Mennea was an Italian sprinter, politician and essayist.
 

Olympic champion of the 200 meters in Moscow 1980, he was the world record holder of the specialty from 1979 to 1996 with a time of 19 "72 which still constitutes, after more than 40 years, the European record. 

the Italian record of 100 flat meters with a time of 10 "01, then beaten by Filippo Tortu. 

Nicknamed Freccia del Sud, he is the only 200th player in history who qualified for four consecutive Olympic finals (from 1972 to 1984). 
By virtue of his sporting career he was awarded the Olympic order in 1997 and inducted into the FIDAL Hall of Fame.
